intro: Vulpiella stipoides var. letourneauxii, commonly known as the Letourneaux's sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a low-growing annual herb with slender, branching stems and small, opposite leaves. The flowers are typically pink to purple, arranged in dense clusters at the tips of the stems. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is an important species in its native ecosystem.
